turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: That puts us right here... Which means we can head straight for the Sub Arachnoid Cavity.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: If we can go in past the Oculomotor Nerve...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: It's against my better Judgment...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Better Judgment?! To wait until the actual operation -- when it may be too late?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: I've done all I could with the laser.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: All I'm asking is you test it beforehand!

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: If it won't work, it's beyond my power to fix it. But if it does, there's no telling how long it will hold up. It's a jury rig, at best, and we'll need every second of use we can get out of it. That's why I don't want to put any extra strain on the connections by running unnecessary tests.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Dr. Duvall I insist you test the laser.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: I'll do nothing of the sort! The operation is <my> responsibility! I won't do it, and that's final!

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: As usual, you want everything your way. Except this time there's more than your damned ego at stake.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: I know only too well what's in the balance, Doctor. And it's not my ego, damned or otherwise.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: The Soul? The finite mind cannot comprehend Infinity. And the Soul which comes from God is Infinite.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Take a close look at your Soul, and your Infinity, and your God out there --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: --and certain chemicals involving proteins --

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: You left something out.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: The Breath of God...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Removal Point? What're you talking about!

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: We have no alternative. With only six minutes left, we'll just barely make it.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Dr. Duval, you are not going through with this! I absolutely forbid it! I'm responsible for the lives of everyone here! I will not allow you or anyone else to leave this ship!

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: I'm going to do what I can to save Benes.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: The Medieval Philosophers were right... <Man> is the center of the Universe... We stand in the middle of Infinity, between Outer and Inner Space. And there's no limit to either.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You mean Inner Space is endless?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Everything can be divided in half, no matter how minute.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Only to the naked eye.  Those corpuscles -- carrying oxygen -- give the stream its color. But the rest of the plasma's very much like sea water. An ocean of life...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Quite a piece of plumbing.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I'd hate to get lost on that Freeway...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: They all lead to the same place -- the Lungs.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Mind letting me in on what's going on out there?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: A simple exchange, Mr. Grant. Corpuscles releasing carbon dioxide -- the moment they touch the Wall of the Lung -- in return for oxygen coming through from the other side.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Don't tell me they're refueling...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Oxygenation...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Just a few cells away from a vast air chamber -- one of the countless Alvioli of the Lung -- and we can't get enough to fill a microscopic tank.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Maybe we can...  Skipper, is there a snorkel on this sub?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Isn't there another surgical procedure you can try?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: No, there's no other way.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: We'll never get there in time, at this rate.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Isn't there another route? So we can by-pass all this?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Yes...  We can transfer over to the Inner Ear, and go by way of the Endolymphatic Duct.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Then why not take it?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: "Yet all the suns that light the Corridors of the Universe shine dim, Before the blazing of a Single Thought -- "

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: "Proclaiming in incandescent glory The myriad Mind of Man..."

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: How does it look, Doctor?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: If I can relieve the pressure on a few key vessels...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Doctor, we've just about had it.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: It I can clear this Central Nerve, that <may> be enough...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: The ship's good as finished. We'll have to get out on our own! Is there a quick way out?

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: We could follow the Optic Nerve to the corner of the Eye.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You said there was a quick way out!

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: What about Dr. Michaels?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: It's too late!

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: We need you for Security purposes, Mr. Grant.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: At an operation?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: They know they failed to kill Benes. Security thinks they'll try again, first chance they get. We're afraid of medical sabotage -- or surgical assassination.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Surgical assassination?! But that means you suspect --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Miss Peterson, his Technical Assistant.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: How are you, Miss Peterson?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: About forty miles an hour.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Well, it seems to me if you reduce a ship to microscopic size -- and the stream remains constant -- we'd take quite a beating.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: A forced joining of an Artery and Vein. Must've happened when Benes was hurt.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: If we can't go back, is there an alternate route?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes... We can go forward on this course, but it means going directly through the Heart.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That's just dandy. We can't go forward -- and we can't go back.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I'm afraid there's only one thing we can do. Call off the mission.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Tell them to take us out.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: If there's any chance --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Request removal, Mr. Grant.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Sounds like heavy artillery...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: It lays down quite a barrage in a lifetime. Forty million beats.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: There it is!

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Fasten yourselves in. There should be a tremendous surge when the Heart starts up again.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: At this size, I would certainly think so.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: If those Corpuscles can take on air, no reason why we can't.  All we have to do is hook up the snorkel to that air chamber you were talk1ng about, and when Benes inhales, there should be plenty of pressure to force the oxygen into the tank.  How's that sound to you, Skipper?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: In a way -- yes. Those are impurities imbedded in the Lung after a lifetime of 'Civilization.' Carbon from smoke and smog -- specks of dust --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Well, we better get on with it.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes -- with all that pressure, and suction within --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: There's no other way. Tie my safety line to the sub.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: All right now -- push the snorkel through as soon as I get inside.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Walt for the lull -- between the time he inhales and exhales.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Grant -- wait a minute -- you're not going to dismantle the wireless?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Just one little transistor and a circuit wire is all it takes.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: But that'll knock out our communications! We'll be cutting ourselves off from the outside.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: They'll still be able to track us by radar, because of the radioactive fuel.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Well, sir? Which is it? The wireless, or Benes' life?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Send the following message...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Looks like the sea, at dawn.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: We're safe -- long as it remains that color...  We're in the Pleural Sac.  It keeps the Lungs from rubbing against the Wall of the Chest up there. When those membranes become inflamed, we wind up with Pleurisy -- and a wracking cough.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Cough? If he can kick up a storm by just <breathing> --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: His Pleura's in fine condition. It should be clear sailing through this area.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Let's hope... So far, somebody's tried to sabotage this mission twice.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Sabotage? I don't understand...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I saw the laser just before we started. It was fastened down securely. You don't suppose what happened was an 'accident?' Any more than my safety line snapping after it was tied off to the sub?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: You have no right to blame Duval --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That line was tampered with...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I -- I don't know what to say. I know he's under a cloud, but there's not a more dedicated man in the entire medical profession.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You still never know what's going on in anyone's mind...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I can't believe it. Whatever happened was an accident.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Two in a row?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: It's possible --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: We're entering the Lymphatic System. Those are nuclei of cells, lining a Duct.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I always had an idea there was only one System. The Circulatory.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: The Lymphatic System drains off excess fluid from the Tissues. Without it, we'd all swell up like balloons. He reaches the console, begins to take out a new chart.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Skipper, you're picking up seaweed -- or whatever it is.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Reticular fibers. We ought to be clear of them soon.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Looks like somebody declared war.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Just what it is. Antibodies, destroying Bacteria -- or any other foreign invader that threatens the System.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: They're tracking us Topside. Once they see where we're going, I'm sure they'll take every precaution.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Let's hope they realize the danger.  Captain, I'll give you a new compass heading.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Looks like quite a way to go...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: No, we should reach the base of the Brain shortly. And from there, it's not far to the site of the injury.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Hold it, Skipper.  What happens if we overstay?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Once time's up, De-Miniaturization begins. In a matter of seconds the ship will grow big enough to become a danger to the System. Then White Corpuscles will swarm to destroy it, as they would any invader.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: How long will it take to get from here to the Removal Point?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I'm in charge of this mission! You were instructed to take orders from me, not give them!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Sorry, but the situation has changed.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Nothing has changed as far as <my> authority goes! He is <not> going to operate! Not in the little time we have left! There's no chance of success! It's sheer suicide for all of us!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I don't believe that.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Why not? Because of his gibberish about GOd and the Soul? Camouflage -- that's all it is -- to blind the gullible like you! And to hide his real identity -- a fanatic whose only purpose is to kill Benes! And you made it possible!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Sorry we had to get you up at this hour, Mr. Grant.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I thought I was on my vacation... What's it all about?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Where we going?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I can't tell you that either... Excuse me, Mr. Grant, but you've got a smudge on your cheek.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: May I?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What'd you do that for?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm married.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: And she said it was indelible...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Out of your element, aren't you, Captain?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That makes two of us.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Atomic fuel?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Nothing you could see with the naked eye. But there's a microscopic radio-active particle inside.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: If it's no military secret, how can a sub run on a microscopic particle?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: They can't reduce nuclear fuel. But once the Reactor's Miniaturized -- along with the submarine -- a microscopic particle should emit enough energy to activate it.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That's cutting it mighty close -- for a perfect fit.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: It should work -- theoretically. If it doesn't, the mission's off. The craft's nuclear-powered. Except for your wireless.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: All in all, quite a canoe...

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Designed for Piscatorial Research -- the Spawning Habits of Deep Sea Fish.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Remind me to ask you about the love life of an octupus.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: 'Prepare for Miniaturization'...

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Positions, please. And strap yourselves in.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Any reserve air?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Enough to breathe, but that's all.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I've come up against fanatics before, and Duval just doesn't fit the pattern.  I'm going out there, Skipper. Maybe I can be of some help...

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Remember -- we can't take more than five minutes to get out.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Dr. Michaels... He went berserk...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Berserk nothing. He's the one who's been sabotaging the mission...  Get this on. Hurry!

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Come on -- it's no use!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We can get out through the Lab Section.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Who, me? Oh, no! Don't bother about me! We're not hurt! Isn't that right, Skipper?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Uh -- what?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We feel great, don't we? Just <great>?!

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Oh -- sure, sure! Never better!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Nothing wrong with us! Not a thing! We're fine -- just fine!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What is it, Skipper?

turns.speaker: OWENS' VOICE
turns.text: We're losing pressure in the Flotation Tanks. Check the Manual, right over there.

turns.speaker: OWENS' VOICE
turns.text: Yes, there is.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Could I run a tube through that Wall, without harming Benes?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Thirty-two minutes left...  But chances are we won't have to wait that long for try-number three.

turns.speaker: OWENS' VOICE
turns.text: Look at those Walls up ahead!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What's wrong, Skipper?

turns.speaker: OWENS' VOICE
turns.text: What I was afraid would happen. The stuff we passed through -- that looked like seaweed --

turns.speaker: OWENS' VOICE
turns.text: How's it look?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I could use a lawnmower...

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Even so, because of our size -- I mean lack of it -- we'll still be cruising mighty fast. We'll be smashed to bits if there's any turbulence --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: The only danger of turbulence is in the Heart -- and we're not going through it.  Once in the Carotid Artery, we'll remain in the Arterial System... until we reach the point of damage --  -- where Dr. Duval will attempt to dissolve the clot with a laser beam. After the operation, we'll return by way of the Venous System --  -- until we reach the base of the neck --  -- where we'll be removed right here -- with a hypodermic.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Captain, how will you be able to follow my charts --  --from up there?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: On the Repeater.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: That's it...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Looks simple to operate.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: I'll never find my way through that.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I'll guide you, once we're in the Heart.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Well, that takes care of the valve. It was probably caused by that electric shock.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Was there any damage?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Not to the valve. But we've lost too much air to make it the rest of the way.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: It's a dangerous procedure. If I miss the timing, we could explode the tanks... But I'm willing to try it.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes, by all means. We must try it.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: We could never fight that current it's physically impossible.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS' VOICE
turns.text: Then don't drift down further.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: I'll do what I can.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Doctor -- the channel's getting awful narrow.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS' VOICE
turns.text: We're entering a Capillary. Remain in the middle.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: The Wall's transparent...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS' VOICE
turns.text: It's less than one ten-thousandth of an inch thick. And porous.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS' VOICE
turns.text: There seems to be something wrong with the Escape Hatch...

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS' VOICE
turns.text: Fluid is seeping through. Better come down and have a look!

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: ...What do you mean, you decided not to park here?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah, I just came in. I decided not to park here.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: You, uh... I'm sorry, sir, but -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I decided not to - I'm, uh, not taking the trip as it turns out.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir, we do have to charge you the four dollars.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I just pulled in here. I just fucking pulled in here!

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Well, see, there's a minimum charge of four dollars. Long-term parking charges by the day.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Ophhem ma fuchem gaphe!

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: May I have your ticket, please?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Who the fuck are you? Who the fuck are you?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I got your goddamn money, you little punk. Now where's my daughter?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I am through fucking around! Drop that fucking briefcase!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Where's my daughter?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Fuck you, man! Where's Jerry? I gave SIMPLE FUCKING INSTRUCTIONS -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Where's my damn daughter? No Jean, no money!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Drop that fucking money!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: No Jean, no money!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Is this a fucking joke here?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...Is this a fucking joke?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Unghh... oh, geez...

turns.speaker: TROOPER
turns.text: This is a new car, then, sir?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: It certainly is, officer. Still got that smell!

turns.speaker: TROOPER
turns.text: You're required to display temporary tags, either in the plate area or taped inside the back window.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Certainly -

turns.speaker: TROOPER
turns.text: Can I see your license and registration please?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Certainly.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...So maybe the best thing would be to take care of that, right here in Brainerd.

turns.speaker: TROOPER
turns.text: What's this, sir?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: That's my license and registration. I wanna be in compliance.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Just in town on business. Just in and out. Ha ha! A little of the old in-and-out!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Wuddya do?  Carl looks around.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Have ya been to the Celebrity Room before? With other, uh, clients?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I don't think so. It's nice.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah, well, it depends on the artist. You know, Jose Feliciano, ya got no complaints. Waiter!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ... What is he, deaf?... So, uh, how long have you been with the escort service?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I don't know. Few munce.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Ya find the work interesting, do ya?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...What're you talking about?

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: Or your fucking wife, you know.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Or your fucking wife, Jerry.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: Where is Pancakes Hause?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: We stop at Pancakes Hause.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What're you, nuts? We had pancakes for breakfast. I gotta go somewhere I can get a shot and a beer - and a steak maybe.  Not more fuckin' pancakes. Come on.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...Come on, man. Okay, here's an idea. We'll stop outside of Brainerd. I know a place there we can get laid. Wuddya think?

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: I'm fuckin' hungry now, you know.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, Jesus - I'm sayin', we'll stop for pancakes, then we'll get laid. Wuddya think?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...Look at that. Twin Cities.  IDS Building, the big glass one.  Tallest skyscraper in the Midwest.  After the Sears, uh, Chicago...  You never been to Minneapolis?

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...Would it kill you to say something?

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: "No." First thing you've said in the last four hours. That's a, that's a fountain of conversation, man. That's a geyser. I mean, whoa, daddy, stand back, man. Shit, I'm sittin' here driving, man, doin' all the driving, whole fuckin' way from Brainerd, drivin', tryin' to, you know, tryin' to chat, keep our spirits up, fight the boredom of the road, and you can't say one fucking thing just in the way of conversation.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: Unguent.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Huh?  Grimsurd looks at his thumb.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: I need ...unguent.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: Shut the fuck up or I'll throw you back in the trunk, you know.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Geez. That's more'n I've heard you say all week.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: You'll take care of it. Boy, you are smooth smooth, you know.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Whoa, Daddy.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: Clear him off the road.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: She started shrieking, you know.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Jezhush.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...You c'n'ave my truck. I'm takin' a Shiera.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: We split that.

turns.speaker: GRIMSRUD
turns.text: One of us pays the other for half.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: HOLD ON! NO FUCKIN' WAY! YOU FUCKIN' NOTISH ISH? I GOT FUCKIN' SHOT INNA FAISH! I WENT'N GOTTA FUCKIN' MONEY! I GET SHOT FUCKIN' PICKIN' IT UP!  I BEEN UP FOR THIRTY-SHIKSH FUCKIN' HOURZH! I'M TAKIN' THAT FUCKIN' CAR! THAT FUCKERZH MINE!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...So I guess that's it, then.  Here's the keys -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: No, that's not it, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: The new vehicle, plus forty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, but the deal was, the car first, see, then the forty thousand, like as if it was the ransom. I thought Shep told you -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Shep didn't tell us much, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, okay, it's -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Except that you were gonna be here at 7:30.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, well, that was a mix-up, then.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah, you already said that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah. But it's not a whole pay-in- advance deal. I give you a brand-new vehicle in advance and -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I'm not gonna debate you, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I'm not gonna sit here and debate. I will say this though: what Shep told us didn't make a whole lot of sense.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, no, it's real sound. It's all worked out.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: You want your own wife kidnapped?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...You-my point is, you pay the ransom- what eighty thousand bucks?  - I mean, you give us half the ransom, forty thousand, you keep half. It's like robbing Peter to play Paul, it doesn't make any -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay, it's - see, it's not me payin' the ransom. The thing is, my wife, she's wealthy - her dad, he's real well off. Now, I'm in a bit of trouble -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What kind of trouble are you in, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, that's, that's, I'm not go inta, inta - see, I just need money. Now, her dad's real wealthy -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: So why don't you just ask him for the money?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, it's all just part of this - they don't know I need it, see. Okay, so there's that. And even if they did, I wouldn't get it.  So there's that on top, then. See, these're personal matters.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Personal matters.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah. Personal matters that needn't, uh -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Okay, Jerry. You're tasking us to perform this mission, but you, you won't, uh, you won't - aw, fuck it, let's take a look at that Ciera.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...Who's Jean?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: My wife! What the - how's -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Oh, Jean's okay. But there's three people up in Brainerd who aren't so okay, I'll tell ya that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What the heck're you talkin' about? Let's just finish up this deal here -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Blood has been shed, Jerry.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...Blood has been shed.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What the heck d'ya mean?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Three people. In Brainerd.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, geez.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: That's right. And we need more money.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The heck d'ya mean? What a you guys got yourself mixed up in?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: We need more -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: This was s'posed to be a no-rough stuff-type deal -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: DON'T EVER INTERRUPT ME, JERRY! JUST SHUT THE FUCK UP!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, I'm sorry, but I just - I -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Look. I'm not gonna debate you, Jerry. The price is now the whole amount. We want the entire eighty thousand.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, for Chrissakes here -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Blood has been shed. We've incurred risks, Jerry. I'm coming into town tomorrow. Have the money ready.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now we had a deal here! A deal's a deal!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: IS IT, JERRY?  You ask those three pour souls up in Brainerd if a deal's a deal! Go ahead, ask 'em!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...The heck d'ya mean?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, I got the money, but, uh -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Don't you fucking but me, Jerry.  I want you with this money on the Dayton- Radisson parking ramp, top level, thirty minutes, and we'll wrap this up.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, okay, but, uh -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: You're there in thirty minutes or I find you, Jerry, and I shoot you, and I shoot your fucking wife, and I shoot all your little fucking children, and I shoot 'em all in the back of their little fucking heads. Got it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...Yah, well, you stay away from Scotty now -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: GOT IT?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay, real good, then.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: We sat here right in this room and went over this and over this!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, but that TruCoat -

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: I sat right here and said I didn't want no TruCoat!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, but I'm sayin', that TruCoat, you don't get it and you get oxidization problems. It'll cost you a heck of lot more'n five hunnert -

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: You're sittin' here, you're talkin' in circles! You're talkin' like we didn't go over this already!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, but this TruCoat -

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: We had us a deal here for nineteen- five. You sat there and darned if you didn't tell me you'd get this car, these options, WITHOUT THE SEALANT, for nineteen-five!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay, I'm not sayin' I didn't -

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: You called me twenty minutes ago and said you had it! Ready to make delivery, ya says! Come on down and get it!  And here ya are and you're wastin' my time and you're wastin' my wife's time and I'm payin' nineteen- five for this vehicle here!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, okay, I'll talk to my boss...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, he never done this before, but seein' as it's special circumstances and all, he says I can knock one hunnert off that TruCoat.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: One hundred! You lied to me, Mr. Lundegaard. You're a bald-faced liar!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: One hunnert's the best we can do here.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Oh, for Christ's sake, where's my goddamn checkbook. Let's get this over with.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, ya got yer, this loaded here, this has yer independent, uh, yer slipped differential, uh, yer rack- and-pinion steering, yer alarm and radar, and I can give it to ya with a heck of a sealant, this TruCoat stuff, it'll keep the salt off -

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Yah, I don't need no sealant though.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, you don't need that. Now were you thinking of financing here?  You oughta be aware a this GMAC plan they have now, it's really super -
